thread.title: The Trick Play the Philadelphia Eagles Borrowed to Win the Super Bowl

author: Andrew Beaton
title: The Trick Play the Philadelphia Eagles Borrowed to Win the Super Bowl
text:
MINNEAPOLIS—The Philadelphia Eagles needed a play that would work. It was fourth down from New England’s 1-yard-line late in the second quarter of Super Bowl LII. The team that went for it on fourth downs all season was about to go for it again.
The crazy part about their decision to play for the touchdown wasn’t the decision itself. It was the play the Eagles chose: a dash of trickery they borrowed from the playbooks of teams at every level of football.
